# SQLite export

You can write parsed RDS outputs into a single SQLite database with
`write_sqlite_from_rds()`. This uses the RDS bundles or per-table RDS files on
disk (no re-parsing required).

## Example

```{r, eval=FALSE}
library(spatialSportsR)

write_sqlite_from_rds(
  root_dir = "data/parsed",
  league = "nba",
  sources = c("espn", "nba_stats"),
  seasons = c("2026", "2025-26"),
  season_type = "regular",
  db_path = "data/parsed/nba.sqlite",
  mode = "append",
  bundle = TRUE,
  table_prefix = "source",
  debug = TRUE
)
```

## Notes

- If `table_prefix = "source"`, tables are named `espn_games`,
  `nba_stats_games`, etc.
- Date/time columns are written as ISO strings in SQLite for readability.
